speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: SCENE II. Ante-chamber to KING HENRY VIII's apartment.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Enter NORFOLK, SUFFOLK, SURREY, and Chamberlain

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: If you will now unite in your complaints,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And force them with a constancy, the cardinal

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Cannot stand under them: if you omit

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The offer of this time, I cannot promise

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: But that you shall sustain moe new disgraces,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: With these you bear already.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: I am joyful

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: To meet the least occasion that may give me

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Remembrance of my father-in-law, the duke,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: To be revenged on him.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Which of the peers

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Have uncontemn'd gone by him, or at least

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Strangely neglected? when did he regard

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The stamp of nobleness in any person

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Out of himself?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: My lords, you speak your pleasures:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: What he deserves of you and me I know;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: What we can do to him, though now the time

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Gives way to us, I much fear. If you cannot

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Bar his access to the king, never attempt

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Any thing on him; for he hath a witchcraft

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Over the king in's tongue.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: O, fear him not;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: His spell in that is out: the king hath found

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Matter against him that for ever mars

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The honey of his language. No, he's settled,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Not to come off, in his displeasure.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: I should be glad to hear such news as this

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Once every hour.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Believe it, this is true:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: In the divorce his contrary proceedings

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Are all unfolded wherein he appears

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: As I would wish mine enemy.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: How came

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: His practises to light?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Most strangely.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: O, how, how?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The cardinal's letters to the pope miscarried,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And came to the eye o' the king: wherein was read,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How that the cardinal did entreat his holiness

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To stay the judgment o' the divorce; for if

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: It did take place, 'I do,' quoth he, 'perceive

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: My king is tangled in affection to

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A creature of the queen's, Lady Anne Bullen.'

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Has the king this?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Believe it.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Will this work?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The king in this perceives him, how he coasts

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: And hedges his own way. But in this point

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: All his tricks founder, and he brings his physic

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: After his patient's death: the king already

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Hath married the fair lady.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Would he had!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: May you be happy in your wish, my lord

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For, I profess, you have it.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Now, all my joy

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Trace the conjunction!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: My amen to't!

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: All men's!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: There's order given for her coronation:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Marry, this is yet but young, and may be left

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To some ears unrecounted. But, my lords,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: She is a gallant creature, and complete

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In mind and feature: I persuade me, from her

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Will fall some blessing to this land, which shall

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In it be memorised.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: But, will the king

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Digest this letter of the cardinal's?

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: The Lord forbid!

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Marry, amen!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No, no;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: There be moe wasps that buzz about his nose

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Will make this sting the sooner. Cardinal Campeius

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Is stol'n away to Rome; hath ta'en no leave;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Has left the cause o' the king unhandled; and

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Is posted, as the agent of our cardinal,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To second all his plot. I do assure you

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The king cried Ha! at this.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Now, God incense him,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: And let him cry Ha! louder!

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: But, my lord,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: When returns Cranmer?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: He is return'd in his opinions; which

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Have satisfied the king for his divorce,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Together with all famous colleges

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Almost in Christendom: shortly, I believe,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: His second marriage shall be publish'd, and

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Her coronation. Katharine no more

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Shall be call'd queen, but princess dowager

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And widow to Prince Arthur.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: This same Cranmer's

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: A worthy fellow, and hath ta'en much pain

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: In the king's business.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: He has; and we shall see him

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For it an archbishop.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: So I hear.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: 'Tis so.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The cardinal!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY and CROMWELL

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Observe, observe, he's moody.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The packet, Cromwell.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Gave't you the king?

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: To his own hand, in's bedchamber.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Look'd he o' the inside of the paper?

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Presently

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: He did unseal them: and the first he view'd,

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: He did it with a serious mind; a heed

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Was in his countenance. You he bade

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Attend him here this morning.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Is he ready

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To come abroad?

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: I think, by this he is.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Leave me awhile.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Exit CROMWELL

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Aside

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: It shall be to the Duchess of Alencon,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The French king's sister: he shall marry her.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Anne Bullen! No; I'll no Anne Bullens for him:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: There's more in't than fair visage. Bullen!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: No, we'll no Bullens. Speedily I wish

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To hear from Rome. The Marchioness of Pembroke!

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: He's discontented.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: May be, he hears the king

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Does whet his anger to him.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Sharp enough,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Lord, for thy justice!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: [Aside]  The late queen's gentlewoman,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: a knight's daughter,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To be her mistress' mistress! the queen's queen!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: This candle burns not clear: 'tis I must snuff it;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Then out it goes. What though I know her virtuous

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And well deserving? yet I know her for

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A spleeny Lutheran; and not wholesome to

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Our cause, that she should lie i' the bosom of

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Our hard-ruled king. Again, there is sprung up

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: An heretic, an arch one, Cranmer; one

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Hath crawl'd into the favour of the king,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And is his oracle.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: He is vex'd at something.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: I would 'twere something that would fret the string,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: The master-cord on's heart!

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Enter KING HENRY VIII, reading of a schedule, and LOVELL

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The king, the king!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: What piles of wealth hath he accumulated

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To his own portion! and what expense by the hour

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Seems to flow from him! How, i' the name of thrift,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Does he rake this together! Now, my lords,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Saw you the cardinal?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: My lord, we have

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Stood here observing him: some strange commotion

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Is in his brain: he bites his lip, and starts;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Stops on a sudden, looks upon the ground,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Then lays his finger on his temple, straight

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Springs out into fast gait; then stops again,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Strikes his breast hard, and anon he casts

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: His eye against the moon: in most strange postures

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: We have seen him set himself.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: It may well be;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: There is a mutiny in's mind. This morning

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Papers of state he sent me to peruse,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: As I required: and wot you what I found

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: There,--on my conscience, put unwittingly?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Forsooth, an inventory, thus importing;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The several parcels of his plate, his treasure,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Rich stuffs, and ornaments of household; which

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I find at such proud rate, that it out-speaks

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Possession of a subject.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: It's heaven's will:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Some spirit put this paper in the packet,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To bless your eye withal.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: If we did think

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: His contemplation were above the earth,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And fix'd on spiritual object, he should still

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Dwell in his musings: but I am afraid

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: His thinkings are below the moon, not worth

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: His serious considering.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: King HENRY VIII takes his seat; whispers LOVELL, who goes to CARDINAL WOLSEY

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Heaven forgive me!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Ever God bless your highness!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Good my lord,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You are full of heavenly stuff, and bear the inventory

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Of your best graces in your mind; the which

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You were now running o'er: you have scarce time

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To steal from spiritual leisure a brief span

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To keep your earthly audit: sure, in that

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I deem you an ill husband, and am glad

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To have you therein my companion.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For holy offices I have a time; a time

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To think upon the part of business which

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I bear i' the state; and nature does require

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Her times of preservation, which perforce

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I, her frail son, amongst my brethren mortal,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Must give my tendence to.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You have said well.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And ever may your highness yoke together,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: As I will lend you cause, my doing well

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: With my well saying!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: 'Tis well said again;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And 'tis a kind of good deed to say well:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And yet words are no deeds. My father loved you:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: His said he did; and with his deed did crown

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: His word upon you. Since I had my office,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I have kept you next my heart; have not alone

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Employ'd you where high profits might come home,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: But pared my present havings, to bestow

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My bounties upon you.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: [Aside]             What should this mean?

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: [Aside]  The Lord increase this business!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Have I not made you,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The prime man of the state? I pray you, tell me,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: If what I now pronounce you have found true:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And, if you may confess it, say withal,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: If you are bound to us or no. What say you?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: My sovereign, I confess your royal graces,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Shower'd on me daily, have been more than could

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: My studied purposes requite; which went

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Beyond all man's endeavours: my endeavours

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Have ever come too short of my desires,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Yet filed with my abilities: mine own ends

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Have been mine so that evermore they pointed

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To the good of your most sacred person and

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The profit of the state. For your great graces

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Heap'd upon me, poor undeserver, I

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Can nothing render but allegiant thanks,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: My prayers to heaven for you, my loyalty,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Which ever has and ever shall be growing,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Till death, that winter, kill it.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Fairly answer'd;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: A loyal and obedient subject is

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Therein illustrated: the honour of it

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Does pay the act of it; as, i' the contrary,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The foulness is the punishment. I presume

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That, as my hand has open'd bounty to you,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My heart dropp'd love, my power rain'd honour, more

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: On you than any; so your hand and heart,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Your brain, and every function of your power,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Should, notwithstanding that your bond of duty,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: As 'twere in love's particular, be more

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To me, your friend, than any.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I do profess

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That for your highness' good I ever labour'd

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: More than mine own; that am, have, and will be--

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Though all the world should crack their duty to you,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And throw it from their soul; though perils did

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Abound, as thick as thought could make 'em, and

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Appear in forms more horrid,--yet my duty,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: As doth a rock against the chiding flood,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Should the approach of this wild river break,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And stand unshaken yours.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: 'Tis nobly spoken:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Take notice, lords, he has a loyal breast,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: For you have seen him open't. Read o'er this;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Giving him papers

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And after, this: and then to breakfast with

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: What appetite you have.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exit KING HENRY VIII, frowning upon CARDINAL WOLSEY: the Nobles throng after him, smiling and whispering

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What should this mean?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What sudden anger's this? how have I reap'd it?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: He parted frowning from me, as if ruin

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Leap'd from his eyes: so looks the chafed lion

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Upon the daring huntsman that has gall'd him;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Then makes him nothing. I must read this paper;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I fear, the story of his anger. 'Tis so;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: This paper has undone me: 'tis the account

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of all that world of wealth I have drawn together

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For mine own ends; indeed, to gain the popedom,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And fee my friends in Rome. O negligence!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Fit for a fool to fall by: what cross devil

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Made me put this main secret in the packet

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I sent the king? Is there no way to cure this?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: No new device to beat this from his brains?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I know 'twill stir him strongly; yet I know

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A way, if it take right, in spite of fortune

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Will bring me off again. What's this? 'To the Pope!'

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The letter, as I live, with all the business

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I writ to's holiness. Nay then, farewell!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And, from that full meridian of my glory,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I haste now to my setting: I shall fall

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Like a bright exhalation m the evening,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And no man see me more.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Re-enter to CARDINAL WOLSEY, NORFOLK and SUFFOLK, SURREY, and the Chamberlain

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Hear the king's pleasure, cardinal: who commands you

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To render up the great seal presently

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Into our hands; and to confine yourself

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To Asher House, my Lord of Winchester's,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Till you hear further from his highness.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Stay:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Where's your commission, lords? words cannot carry

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Authority so weighty.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Who dare cross 'em,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Bearing the king's will from his mouth expressly?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Till I find more than will or words to do it,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I mean your malice, know, officious lords,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I dare and must deny it. Now I feel

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of what coarse metal ye are moulded, envy:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: How eagerly ye follow my disgraces,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: As if it fed ye! and how sleek and wanton

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Ye appear in every thing may bring my ruin!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Follow your envious courses, men of malice;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You have Christian warrant for 'em, and, no doubt,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: In time will find their fit rewards. That seal,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You ask with such a violence, the king,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Mine and your master, with his own hand gave me;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Bade me enjoy it, with the place and honours,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: During my life; and, to confirm his goodness,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Tied it by letters-patents: now, who'll take it?

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: The king, that gave it.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: It must be himself, then.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Thou art a proud traitor, priest.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Proud lord, thou liest:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Within these forty hours Surrey durst better

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Have burnt that tongue than said so.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Thy ambition,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Thou scarlet sin, robb'd this bewailing land

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Of noble Buckingham, my father-in-law:

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: The heads of all thy brother cardinals,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: With thee and all thy best parts bound together,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Weigh'd not a hair of his. Plague of your policy!

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: You sent me deputy for Ireland;

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Far from his succor, from the king, from all

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: That might have mercy on the fault thou gavest him;

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Whilst your great goodness, out of holy pity,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Absolved him with an axe.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: This, and all else

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: This talking lord can lay upon my credit,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I answer is most false. The duke by law

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Found his deserts: how innocent I was

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: From any private malice in his end,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: His noble jury and foul cause can witness.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: If I loved many words, lord, I should tell you

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You have as little honesty as honour,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That in the way of loyalty and truth

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Toward the king, my ever royal master,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Dare mate a sounder man than Surrey can be,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And all that love his follies.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: By my soul,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Your long coat, priest, protects you; thou

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: shouldst feel

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: My sword i' the life-blood of thee else. My lords,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Can ye endure to hear this arrogance?

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: And from this fellow? if we live thus tamely,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: To be thus jaded by a piece of scarlet,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Farewell nobility; let his grace go forward,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: And dare us with his cap like larks.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: All goodness

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Is poison to thy stomach.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Yes, that goodness

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Of gleaning all the land's wealth into one,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Into your own hands, cardinal, by extortion;

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: The goodness of your intercepted packets

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: You writ to the pope against the king: your goodness,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Since you provoke me, shall be most notorious.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: My Lord of Norfolk, as you are truly noble,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: As you respect the common good, the state

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Of our despised nobility, our issues,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Who, if he live, will scarce be gentlemen,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Produce the grand sum of his sins, the articles

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Collected from his life. I'll startle you

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Worse than the scaring bell, when the brown wench

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Lay kissing in your arms, lord cardinal.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: How much, methinks, I could despise this man,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: But that I am bound in charity against it!

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Those articles, my lord, are in the king's hand:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: But, thus much, they are foul ones.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: So much fairer

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And spotless shall mine innocence arise,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: When the king knows my truth.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: This cannot save you:

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: I thank my memory, I yet remember

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Some of these articles; and out they shall.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Now, if you can blush and cry 'guilty,' cardinal,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: You'll show a little honesty.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Speak on, sir;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I dare your worst objections: if I blush,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: It is to see a nobleman want manners.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: I had rather want those than my head. Have at you!

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: First, that, without the king's assent or knowledge,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: You wrought to be a legate; by which power

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: You maim'd the jurisdiction of all bishops.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Then, that in all you writ to Rome, or else

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To foreign princes, 'Ego et Rex meus'

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Was still inscribed; in which you brought the king

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To be your servant.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Then that, without the knowledge

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Either of king or council, when you went

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Ambassador to the emperor, you made bold

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To carry into Flanders the great seal.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Item, you sent a large commission

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: To Gregory de Cassado, to conclude,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Without the king's will or the state's allowance,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: A league between his highness and Ferrara.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That, out of mere ambition, you have caused

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Your holy hat to be stamp'd on the king's coin.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Then that you have sent innumerable substance--

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: By what means got, I leave to your own conscience--

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: To furnish Rome, and to prepare the ways

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: You have for dignities; to the mere undoing

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Of all the kingdom. Many more there are;

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: Which, since they are of you, and odious,

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: I will not taint my mouth with.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: O my lord,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Press not a falling man too far! 'tis virtue:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: His faults lie open to the laws; let them,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Not you, correct him. My heart weeps to see him

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: So little of his great self.

speaker: SURREY
text_entry: I forgive him.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Lord cardinal, the king's further pleasure is,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Because all those things you have done of late,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: By your power legatine, within this kingdom,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Fall into the compass of a praemunire,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That therefore such a writ be sued against you;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To forfeit all your goods, lands, tenements,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Chattels, and whatsoever, and to be

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Out of the king's protection. This is my charge.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And so we'll leave you to your meditations

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: How to live better. For your stubborn answer

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: About the giving back the great seal to us,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The king shall know it, and, no doubt, shall thank you.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: So fare you well, my little good lord cardinal.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Exeunt all but CARDINAL WOLSEY

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: So farewell to the little good you bear me.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Farewell! a long farewell, to all my greatness!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: This is the state of man: to-day he puts forth

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The tender leaves of hopes; to-morrow blossoms,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And bears his blushing honours thick upon him;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The third day comes a frost, a killing frost,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And, when he thinks, good easy man, full surely

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: His greatness is a-ripening, nips his root,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And then he falls, as I do. I have ventured,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Like little wanton boys that swim on bladders,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: This many summers in a sea of glory,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: But far beyond my depth: my high-blown pride

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: At length broke under me and now has left me,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Weary and old with service, to the mercy

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of a rude stream, that must for ever hide me.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Vain pomp and glory of this world, I hate ye:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I feel my heart new open'd. O, how wretched

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Is that poor man that hangs on princes' favours!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: There is, betwixt that smile we would aspire to,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That sweet aspect of princes, and their ruin,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: More pangs and fears than wars or women have:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And when he falls, he falls like Lucifer,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Never to hope again.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Enter CROMWELL, and stands amazed

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Why, how now, Cromwell!

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: I have no power to speak, sir.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What, amazed

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: At my misfortunes? can thy spirit wonder

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A great man should decline? Nay, an you weep,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I am fall'n indeed.

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: How does your grace?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Why, well;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Never so truly happy, my good Cromwell.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I know myself now; and I feel within me

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A peace above all earthly dignities,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A still and quiet conscience. The king has cured me,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I humbly thank his grace; and from these shoulders,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: These ruin'd pillars, out of pity, taken

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A load would sink a navy, too much honour:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: O, 'tis a burthen, Cromwell, 'tis a burthen

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Too heavy for a man that hopes for heaven!

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: I am glad your grace has made that right use of it.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I hope I have: I am able now, methinks,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Out of a fortitude of soul I feel,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To endure more miseries and greater far

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Than my weak-hearted enemies dare offer.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What news abroad?

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: The heaviest and the worst

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Is your displeasure with the king.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: God bless him!

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: The next is, that Sir Thomas More is chosen

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Lord chancellor in your place.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That's somewhat sudden:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: But he's a learned man. May he continue

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Long in his highness' favour, and do justice

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For truth's sake and his conscience; that his bones,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: When he has run his course and sleeps in blessings,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: May have a tomb of orphans' tears wept on em! What more?

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: That Cranmer is return'd with welcome,

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Install'd lord archbishop of Canterbury.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That's news indeed.

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Last, that the Lady Anne,

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Whom the king hath in secrecy long married,

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: This day was view'd in open as his queen,

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Going to chapel; and the voice is now

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Only about her coronation.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: There was the weight that pull'd me down. O Cromwell,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The king has gone beyond me: all my glories

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: In that one woman I have lost for ever:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: No sun shall ever usher forth mine honours,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Or gild again the noble troops that waited

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Upon my smiles. Go, get thee from me, Cromwell;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I am a poor fall'n man, unworthy now

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To be thy lord and master: seek the king;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That sun, I pray, may never set! I have told him

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What and how true thou art: he will advance thee;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Some little memory of me will stir him--

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I know his noble nature--not to let

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Thy hopeful service perish too: good Cromwell,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Neglect him not; make use now, and provide

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For thine own future safety.

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: O my lord,

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Must I, then, leave you? must I needs forego

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: So good, so noble and so true a master?

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Bear witness, all that have not hearts of iron,

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: With what a sorrow Cromwell leaves his lord.

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: The king shall have my service: but my prayers

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: For ever and for ever shall be yours.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Cromwell, I did not think to shed a tear

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: In all my miseries; but thou hast forced me,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Out of thy honest truth, to play the woman.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Let's dry our eyes: and thus far hear me, Cromwell;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And, when I am forgotten, as I shall be,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And sleep in dull cold marble, where no mention

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of me more must be heard of, say, I taught thee,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Say, Wolsey, that once trod the ways of glory,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And sounded all the depths and shoals of honour,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Found thee a way, out of his wreck, to rise in;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A sure and safe one, though thy master miss'd it.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Mark but my fall, and that that ruin'd me.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Cromwell, I charge thee, fling away ambition:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: By that sin fell the angels; how can man, then,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The image of his Maker, hope to win by it?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Love thyself last: cherish those hearts that hate thee;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Corruption wins not more than honesty.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Still in thy right hand carry gentle peace,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To silence envious tongues. Be just, and fear not:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Let all the ends thou aim'st at be thy country's,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Thy God's, and truth's; then if thou fall'st,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: O Cromwell,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Thou fall'st a blessed martyr! Serve the king;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And,--prithee, lead me in:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: There take an inventory of all I have,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To the last penny; 'tis the king's: my robe,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And my integrity to heaven, is all

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I dare now call mine own. O Cromwell, Cromwell!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Had I but served my God with half the zeal

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I served my king, he would not in mine age

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Have left me naked to mine enemies.

speaker: CROMWELL
text_entry: Good sir, have patience.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: So I have. Farewell

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The hopes of court! my hopes in heaven do dwell.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Exeunt
